task_summary: Remove the lid from the pot, place the pot on the plate, then grasp the spatula tool and push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop robot operates over a small work area with a pot that has a removable lid, a round plate, and a spatula tool. The robot first uncovers the pot by taking off the lid. Next, it grasps the pot and places it centered on the plate. Finally, the robot picks the spatula and uses it to push the pot toward the front edge of the table. The sequence demands reliable perception, stable grasps, gentle placement on the plate, and a controlled pushing motion with a handheld tool.
preconditions: Pot, lid, plate, and spatula visible within reachable workspace
Table surface clear enough to maneuver
Tool can be grasped with a side/pinch strategy
stepwise_plan: Detect pot, lid, plate, and spatula.
Approach pot and open/remove the lid.
Compute grasp for the pot, grasp it, lift slightly, and move above the plate.
Place pot on the plate and release.
Compute grasp for spatula, grasp it, move above pot.
Push pot toward the front of the table with the spatula, then release tool and retreat.
success_criteria: Pot is resting stably on the plate
Pot is pushed toward the front edge along the table surface
No objects toppled or moved unintentionally
failure_and_recovery: If lid opening fails: re-approach pot and retry open.
If pot grasp unstable: re-compute grasp and retry pinch strategy.
If placement misaligned: lift and re-place with a second attempt.
If push path obstructed: retreat, adjust approach, and repeat push.
task_long_description.termination: End when pot sits on the plate and has been pushed in the intended frontward direction; gripper is empty and robot safely retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: Robot is aligned over the pot with lid already displaced, signaling readiness to grasp the pot.
frame_3.predicts_next: Grasp and lift of the pot followed by transfer toward the plate.

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Push pot toward front of table.
Back off to a safe pose.
Confirm secure grasp (used after each grasp).

failure_modes: Lid not detected or grasped; pot remains closed
Unstable pot grasp leading to slip during transfer
Misplacement on plate causing pot to fall off
Push direction misaligned; pot not moved frontward
recovery_strategy: Re-detect objects and re-approach if perception uncertain
Re-compute grasp pose and retry pinch grasp
Lift and re-place with corrected alignment
Adjust push direction and repeat with shorter distance
If tool grasp fails, re-grasp with alternate side strategy
assumptions: Front of table is modeled as direction_deg=180 in the task frame.
Spatula can be grasped with a side/pinch strategy.
Plate is the intended placement surface centered under the pot.
Large bowl visible in frames is not part of the task.

expected_success_criteria: ObjectInGripper(pot) true before placement, then false after opening gripper on plate
Pot COM roughly centered within plate area after placement
